query: What is the process for requesting a social care assessment in Croydon?

retrieved_documents.content: . If the adult you care for receives a support package from Croydon Adult Social Care You should request a Carer's Assessment from their allocated Social Worker for the person you care for.  A Carer’s Assessment will not affect the package of care received by the person you care for, as it is a separate assessment based on your needs as a carer.  You can decline a Carer’s Assessment offered by a Social Worker.  However, carers have the right to change their mind at any time, and request an assessment. If the adult you care for does not receive a support package from Croydon Adult Social Care You should contact Carers First: Helpline: 0300 303 1555 Email: hello@carersfirst.org.uk Website: www.carersfirst.org.uk You can also drop into the Carer's Support Centre at: 24 George Street Croydon CR0 1PB Carers Café open Monday, Wednesday and Friday, 10.30am to 12.30pm Advice desk open Monday, Tuesday, Wednesday and Friday, 10am to 1pm. Closed on Thursday

If you are a young carer looking after a Croydon resident who needs support due to illness, disability or old age You can receive a Young Carer’s Assessment from the Off the Record Young Carer's Service. The assessment will let you know what kind of help is available to young carers and what activities are happening. It will also look at what further support would be helpful for you. To contact the service, call 020 8649 9339, option 2 or email youngcarers@talkofftherecord.org . If you care for a disabled child or young person and your child is assessed by Croydon Council as a ‘child in need’ Your child’s assessment should also consider your needs as a family. Local Account, Adult Social Care and Health Croydon - 2023 to 2024Who are we and who do we support?
What are our statutory duties?
The Care Act (2014) sets out the responsibilities we have 
for providing adult social care in Croydon. Its aim is to 
improve people’s independence and wellbeing.
The Act sets out a legal duty for an adult’s ‘eligible needs’ 
to be met by the local authority, subject to their financial circumstances. Their eligible needs are those that are determined after an assessment of need.
The Act makes it clear that local authorities must provide 
or arrange services that help prevent people developing needs for care and support, or delay people deteriorating such that they would need ongoing care and support.Adult Social Care and Health

To request a social care assessment in Croydon, you can contact the Adult Social Care team using several methods.

- **By Phone**: Call 020 8726 6500 if you need to speak to someone or cannot complete the online form.
- **Online**: Use the online form available on the Croydon Council's website to send a referral.
- **In Person**: Visit your local community hub for help and advice.

For more information, you can visit the Croydon Council's website at [Croydon Adult Social Care](https://www.croydon.gov.uk/adult-health-and-social-care/social-care-and-support/step-by-step/understanding-your-care-needs-assessment/how-request-assessment).
